entry.title: Woman makes more from unemployment than when she worked

media:group.media:title: Woman makes more from unemployment than when she worked
media:group.media:description: For some people, unemployment benefits outweigh what they were being paid before to work. This is becoming a problem for business owners looking to reopen. CNN's Kyung Lah reports. #CNN #News

entry.title: Drone footage captures mass graves dug in Brazil

media:group.media:title: Drone footage captures mass graves dug in Brazil
media:group.media:description: CNN's Nick Paton Walsh takes us inside of an ICU in Sao Paulo, Brazil, where medical personnel are struggling to meet the needs of those infected with coronavirus. #CNN #News

entry.title: Trump says he won't wear a mask in front of cameras

media:group.media:title: Trump says he won't wear a mask in front of cameras
media:group.media:description:
President Donald Trump brought a navy blue mask stamped with the presidential seal to a Ford plant in Michigan on Thursday. But he refused to wear it in front of cameras. "I didn't want to give the press the pleasure of seeing it," Trump said before showing off his fabric face covering, which he said he'd briefly strapped on backstage before removing for a tour of the factory. "It was very nice. It looked very nice. They said not necessary." It was another example of Trump shrugging off the rules in place for others that are meant to guard against the coronavirus. As he walked through the facility -- where Ford rules say everyone must wear a mask -- he was surrounded by company executives whose faces were covered.
#Trump #Covid #CNN

entry.title: Man who filmed Ahmaud Arbery shooting arrested for felony murder

media:group.media:title: Man who filmed Ahmaud Arbery shooting arrested for felony murder
media:group.media:description:
William "Roddie" Bryan Jr., the man who recorded the fatal shooting of Ahmaud Arbery in a neighborhood outside Brunswick, Georgia, has been arrested on suspicion of felony murder, the Georgia Bureau of Investigation said on its website. Bryan witnessed the deadly encounter between Travis McMichael and Arbery on February 23 from a vehicle behind a pickup that stopped in the road. Gregory McMichael, who was in the bed of the pickup during the shooting, told police that Bryan had tried to help them stop Arbery earlier. Kevin Gough, an attorney for Bryan, said earlier this week that Bryan had taken a polygraph test that confirmed he was not involved in the shooting. Bryan was unarmed at the time of shooting and that Bryan did not have any conversation with Gregory or Travis McMichael before the shooting, Gough said, citing test results. Bryan took the test voluntarily, Gough said.
#Arbery #CNN #News

entry.title: Legendary virus hunter speaks out after getting infected

media:group.media:title: Legendary virus hunter speaks out after getting infected
media:group.media:description: Legendary virus hunter Peter Piot developed coronavirus symptoms in March and is still experiencing the aftereffects. He speaks with Christiane Amanpour about his ordeal. #CNN #News

entry.title: Michigan AG: Donald Trump is no longer welcome here

media:group.media:title: Michigan AG: Donald Trump is no longer welcome here
media:group.media:description:
Michigan Attorney General Dana Nessel slammed President Donald Trump for setting a bad example by not following health guidelines and wearing a mask during his entire visit to a Ypsilanti, Michigan, Ford Plant. Trump, who says he wore a mask on some parts of the visit, was never seen in front of cameras wearing one even though executives who were accompanying him were.
#Trump #CNN #News

entry.title: Anderson Cooper reacts to 'utterly heartless' Trump tweet

media:group.media:title: Anderson Cooper reacts to 'utterly heartless' Trump tweet
media:group.media:description:
CNN's Anderson Cooper reacts to President Trump's barrage of tweets discrediting mail-in ballots, insulting his political rivals and making unsubstantiated claims about Joe Scarborough, the host of MSNBC's "Morning Joe".
#AC360 #CNN #News

entry.title: Chris Cuomo teases brother Andrew with giant test swab

media:group.media:title: Chris Cuomo teases brother Andrew with giant test swab
media:group.media:description:
New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo, about the size of his nose. On May 17, the governor was tested for Covid-19 on live television to encourage others to get tested.
#Cuomo #CNN #News

entry.title: Michigan AG warns Trump to wear a mask to visit Ford plant

media:group.media:title: Michigan AG warns Trump to wear a mask to visit Ford plant
media:group.media:description:
Michigan's attorney general is warning President Donald Trump to follow health guidelines and wear a mask during his visit to a Ford manufacturing plant. "We are just asking that President Trump comply with the law of our state, just as we would make the same request of anyone else in those plants," Dana Nessel, a Democrat, told CNN's Alisyn Camerota on "New Day" Thursday.
#CNN #News #Covid

entry.title: Nurse shares photos of how Covid ravages the body

media:group.media:title: Nurse shares photos of how Covid ravages the body
media:group.media:description: Mike Schultz, the San Francisco nurse who shared before and after pictures of himself showing the impact that Covid-19 had on his body, describes his struggle to recover from coronavirus. #Covid #CNN #News

entry.title: This is Joe Biden’s best path to win in 2020

media:group.media:title: This is Joe Biden’s best path to win in 2020
media:group.media:description:
In 2016, Donald Trump won Michigan, Wisconsin and Pennsylvania, three states Republican's hadn't won in years. While many believe Democratic nominee Joe Biden's likeliest win would come from taking back the midwest, Chris Cillizza explains why that conventional wisdom may not be Biden's best bet.
SOURCES AND FURTHER READING: Why the Midwest is not *the* 2020 battleground https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/18/politics/2020-battleground-arizona-north-carolina-midwest/index.html
2016 Presidential Election Results https://www.270towin.com/maps/2016-actual-electoral-map
THE POST- POLITICAL REALIGNMENT ELECTORAL COLLEGE MAP https://assets.documentcloud.org/documents/6891686/Biden-Path-to-270-5-15.pdf
Arizona Senate - McSally vs. Kelly https://www.realclearpolitics.com/epolls/2020/senate/az/arizona_senate_mcsally_vs_kelly-6801.html
270toWin: Arizona https://www.270towin.com/states/Arizona
About me: I was named "best dressed" in 7th grade. That, along with being CNN's editor at large and author of the daily "Point" newsletter are my proudest achievements. Look for me here every Tuesday and Thursday to find out what’s really going down in politics.
CREDITS Writer: Chris Cillizza The Point team: Leigh Munsil and Allison Gordon Editor: Michelle Cho Producer: Arielle Sacks

#CNN #Cillizza #Biden2020

entry.title: Biologist explains how to safely celebrate Memorial Day

media:group.media:title: Biologist explains how to safely celebrate Memorial Day
media:group.media:description: University of Massachusetts Dartmouth Biology Professor Erin Bromage shares tips on how to safely celebrate this Memorial Day weekend to reduce coronavirus spread. #CNN #News

entry.title: Meet the two astronauts set to make history in a SpaceX capsule

media:group.media:title: Meet the two astronauts set to make history in a SpaceX capsule
media:group.media:description:
CNN Business' Rachel Crane speaks with veteran NASA astronauts Robert Behnken and Doug Hurley about their upcoming test flight aboard SpaceX's Crew Dragon spacecraft. They'll be the first humans sent to space from US soil since the Shuttle program ended almost a decade ago.
#Space #CNN #News

entry.title: Trump lashes out at swing states over vote-by-mail

media:group.media:title: Trump lashes out at swing states over vote-by-mail
media:group.media:description: President Donald Trump on lashed out at officials in two swing states, Michigan and Nevada, over their moves to make it easier for more voters to cast their ballots by mail ahead of the November election, highlighting his growing anger over mail-in voting changes that he contends will hurt his chances of reelection. The President's harsh and often baseless criticism of vote-by-mail is significantly ratcheting up as more and more states loosen their vote-by-mail restrictions proactively or on court orders. #Trump #CNN #News
